intro: Galactophora colellana, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces a showy inflorescence of star-shaped blooms, which are often tinged with green at the base. It has linear, grass-like leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Galactophora colellana is also known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and full sun conditions.
